title: Modèle mathématique unifié reliant les paramètres géotechniques et géophysiques – Vers une approche de caractérisation des sols intégrée à l’IA
description:
Ce document présente un modèle mathématique appliqué visant à unifier les mesures géotechniques
(type pressiométrique, pénétrométrique) et les mesures géophysiques (sismique, résistivité), dans le
but de prédire les paramètres de portance du sol (ELS / ELU). Le modèle est validé par des
corrélations terrain et intègre une architecture IA modulaire applicable à la reconnaissance
géotechnique.

references.title: Unified Mathematical Model Linking Geotechnical and Geophysical Parameters – Towards an AI-Integrated Soil Characterization Approach
references.description:
This research presents a unified mathematical model connecting geotechnical and geophysical parameters for integrated soil characterization.

The model establishes quantitative correlations between mechanical parameters derived from in-situ tests (pressiometer, penetrometer) and geophysical indicators (resistivity, seismic velocity, and wave propagation).

Empirical relations are derived from experimental field data and validated through site investigations combining electrical resistivity tomography (ERT), seismic refraction, and pressuremeter testing.

The framework introduces a computational sequence linking qd → Vp → Vs → G → Em → ρelec and provides a predictive approach for assessing soil bearing capacity and deformation modulus using both mechanical and non-invasive measurements.

The study also outlines the integration of artificial intelligence modules for adaptive regression and inverse modeling.

This open-access research aims to bridge geotechnical and geophysical domains, providing a unified, reproducible, and AI-extendable methodology for engineers, researchers, and field practitioners.
